sen.j: 京阪神（けいはんしん）は、京都市・大阪市・神戸市の3市の総称、あるいは、これら3市を中心とした近畿地方の主要部を指す地域名称である。
sen.e: Keihanshin is a generic name of the three cities, Kyoto City, Osaka City and Kobe City, or an area name centered in these three cities which indicates the main part of Kinki region.
Keihanshin is both a collective name for the cities of Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe, and an area name indicating the main part of the Kinki region centered around these three cities.
sen.cmt: More natural and concise. "Generic" name is confusing and unclear
sen.e: Keihanshin is both a collective name for the cities of Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe, and an area name indicating the main part of the Kinki region centered around these three cities.

sen.j: 一般的に京阪神と言えば、京阪神大都市圏を指すことが多い。
sen.e: Talking of Keihanshin generally, in many cases, it indicates the Keihanshin Metropolitan area.
Generally speaking, the term Keihanshin often indicates the Keihanshin Metropolitan area.
Generally speaking, the term Keihanshin often indicates the Keihanshin Metropolitan area.

sen.j: しかし、場合によっては下記のような例も見られる。
sen.e: However, in some cases, there can be seen the examples stated below.
However, in some cases, the examples stated below can be seen.
However, in some cases, the examples stated below can be seen.

sen.j: 単純に三都市の頭文字を取ったもので、「京阪神三大学（京都大学・大阪大学・神戸大学）」など三都市に限った事象や施設を一つのグループとして表現する際に使用する。
sen.e: It simply consists of the initial characters of the three cities, and is used when expressing the events and facilities limited to the three cities as a group, such as 'Keihanshin three universities (Kyoto University, Osaka University and Kobe University),' etc.

As it is made up simply of the initial sounds of the three city names, it is used when describing events and facilities limited to those three cities as one group, such as 'The Three Keihanshin Universities (Kyoto University, Osaka University and Kobe University),' etc.
sen.cmt: "Initial characters" is unclear to those who do not speak Japanese. Better grammatical linking. Not sure if "Keihanshin Three Universities" is standard, so I changed it to better English.
sen.e: As it is made up simply of the initial sounds of the three city names, it is used when describing events and facilities limited to those three cities as one group, such as 'The Three Keihanshin Universities (Kyoto University, Osaka University and Kobe University),' etc.

tit.j: 地域名称としての「京阪神」

sen.j: 京都市、大阪市、神戸市、および、これら3市の衛星都市を合わせた都市圏を指す。
sen.e: It indicates an urban area, including Kyoto City, Osaka City and Kobe City jointly with the satellite cities of these three cities.
It indicates an urban area including Kyoto City, Osaka City and Kobe City along with their surrounding smaller cities.
It indicates an urban area including Kyoto City, Osaka City and Kobe City along with their surrounding satellite smaller cities.
sen.cmt: 衛星都市ですのでsatelliteを追加しました。

sen.j: 近畿地方あるいは西日本の中心部。
sen.e: A central part of Kinki region or western Japan.
Kinki region, or the central part of western Japan.
Kinki region, or the central part of western Japan.

sen.j: 上記3市を中心として、近畿2府4県（三重県を除く近畿地方）の全都道府県庁所在地が集中している経済地域。
sen.e: An economic area centered in the three cities above in which the prefectural capitals of all the six prefectures in Kinki region (excluding Mie Prefecture) are concentrated.
sen.cmt: 「近畿2府4県」は"six prefectures in Kinki region"と訳出しています。
sen.e: An economic area centered around the three cities above in which the capitals of all six prefectures in the Kinki region (excluding Mie Prefecture) are concentrated.
sen.cmt: Slight change in wording to make more natural.
sen.e: An economic area centered around the three cities above in which the capitals of all six prefectures in the Kinki region (excluding Mie Prefecture) are concentrated.

sen.j: 各指標により範囲は異なるが、経済・文化的に相互依存関係が強い。
sen.e: An extent is different by each index, however, there is a strong interdependent relationship in terms of economy and culture.
The extent differs depending on what is measured, however, in terms of economy and culture, there is a strong interdependent relationship.
The extent differs depending on what is measured, however, in terms of economy and culture, there is a strong interdependent relationship.

sen.j: 近畿地方の主要部。
sen.e: Main part of Kinki region.
Main part of Kinki region.
Main part of Kinki region.

tit.j: 京阪神大都市圏（GDP世界3位、人口世界6,7位）
tit.e: Keihanshin Metropolitan area (world's 3rd largest GDP, world's 6th to 7th largest population)
Keihanshin Metropolitan area (world's 3rd largest GDP, world's 6th to 7th largest population)
Keihanshin Metropolitan area (world's 3rd largest GDP, world's 6th to 7th largest population)

sen.j: 総務省では、大阪市・京都市・神戸市の3市を中心市とした都市圏 (総務省)（絶対都市圏）を京阪神大都市圏としている（2005年国勢調査）。
sen.e: The Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications specifies an urban area having central cities of the three cities, Osaka City, Kyoto City and Kobe City (Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications) (absolute urban area) as the Keihanshin Metropolitan area (form the national census in 2005).

The Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications specified the urban area with Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe as its central cities (Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications) (absolute urban area) as the Keihanshin Metropolitan area (from the 2005 national census).
sen.cmt: Changed to make it more readable. Is it necessary to repeat the Ministry name? and I can't find a better translation of "絶対都市圏"
sen.e: The Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications specified the urban area with Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe as its central cities (Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications) (absolute urban area) as the Keihanshin Metropolitan area (from the 2005 national census).

sen.j: 範囲は、右上の図の紺色・青色・水色部分に相当し、大阪府全域、兵庫県南部、京都府南部、奈良県北部および南部の一部、滋賀県南部および北部の一部、和歌山県の橋本市・岩出市・かつらぎ町・九度山町、三重県の名張市に及び、人口は約1864万人。
sen.e: The extent corresponds to the parts colored in dark blue, blue and light blue in the right figure, and ranges from the entire area of Osaka prefecture, southern part of Hyogo Prefecture, southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, northern part and a part of southern part of Nara Prefecture, southern part and a part of northern part of Shiga Prefecture, Hashimoto City, Iwade City, Katsuragi Town and Kudoyama Town in Wakayama Prefecture to Nabari City in Mie Prefecture, and the population of which is about 18.64 million people.

The extent corresponds to the parts colored in dark blue, blue and light blue in the right figure, and covers the entire area of Osaka prefecture, the southern part of Hyogo Prefecture, the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, the northern part and part of the southern part of Nara Prefecture, the southern part and part of the northern part of Shiga Prefecture, Hashimoto City, Iwade City, Katsuragi Town and Kudoyama Town in Wakayama Prefecture and Nabari City in Mie Prefecture, with a population of about 18.64 million people.

The extent corresponds to the parts colored in dark blue, blue and light blue in the right figure, and covers the entire area of Osaka prefecture, the southern part of Hyogo Prefecture, the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, the northern part and part of the southern part of Nara Prefecture, the southern part and part of the northern part of Shiga Prefecture, Hashimoto City, Iwade City, Katsuragi Town and Kudoyama Town in Wakayama Prefecture and Nabari City in Mie Prefecture, with a population of about 18.64 million people.

sen.j: 日本では、関東大都市圏に次ぐ規模を誇っており、三大都市圏あるいは七大都市圏の一つとされる一方、世界6～7位の大都市圏である。
sen.e: In Japan, it is proud of the scale following the Kanto Metropolitan area, and is specified as one of the three largest urban areas or the seven largest ones, on the other hand, it is world's 6th to 7th largest urban area.

In Japan, it boasts of a scale second only to the Kanto Metropolitan area, ranked as one of the three major metropolitan areas in the nation and also one of the seven largest, while in the world it is ranked as the 6th to 7th largest urban area.
sen.cmt: Completely changed wording. It seems very redundant to leave in "and also one of the seven largest"
sen.e: In Japan, it boasts of a scale second only to the Kanto Metropolitan area, ranked as one of the three major metropolitan areas in the nation and also one of the seven largest, while in the world it is ranked as the 6th to 7th largest urban area.

sen.j: （→世界の都市圏人口の順位）。
sen.e: (Refer to the rank of the population of urban areas in the world).
(Refer to the ranking of the population of urban areas in the world).
(Refer to the ranking of the population of urban areas in the world).

sen.j: 国内総生産は円安などを考慮すればロサンゼルスを抜き世界第3位。
sen.e: GDP is world's 3rd largest exceeding Los Angeles in consideration of the depreciation of the yen.
The GDP is the world's 3rd largest, exceeding Los Angeles in consideration of the depreciation of the yen.
The GDP is the world's 3rd largest, exceeding Los Angeles in consideration of the depreciation of the yen.

sen.j: この地域の業務・物販面などの第三次産業では、大阪市の都心が抜きん出ているため、同市の都心を中心とした都市圏を京阪神大都市圏と見なすこともある（→大阪を参照）。
sen.e: Since the heart of Osaka City surpasses others in the tertiary industries in business and merchandising aspects, etc. in this area, the urban area centered in the heart of the same city is sometimes regarded as the Keihanshin Metropolitan area (refer to Osaka).

Since the Osaka City center surpasses others in the area in aspects of the tertiary industries such as business and merchandising, the urban area centered in the heart of Osaka is sometimes regarded as the Keihanshin Metropolitan area (refer to Osaka).
sen.cmt: Slightly unclear, I am not sure if this is translated well.
sen.e: Since the Osaka City center surpasses others in the area in aspects of the tertiary industries such as business and merchandising, the urban area centered in the heart of Osaka is sometimes regarded as the Keihanshin Metropolitan area (refer to Osaka).

sen.j: 一方、大阪市・京都市・神戸市の3市は、各々昼間人口が1を超えているため、各々が中心市となって都市圏を形成しているとも考えられる。
sen.e: On the other hand, the daytime population of the three cities, Osaka City, Kyoto City and Kobe City exceeds 1 respectively, and it is also thought that each city would become a center city respectively and form an urban area.

On the other hand, the daytime population of all three cities, Osaka City, Kyoto City and Kobe City, exceeds 1, so it is also thought that each city will become a city center proper and form its own urban area.
sen.cmt: Makes little sense - exceeds 1? Tried to make the wording more natural.
sen.e: more than 10% of its population commuting to a central city

sen.j: その立場に立った都市雇用圏（10%都市圏）では、大阪都市圏、京都都市圏、神戸都市圏と、別々に都市圏（相対都市圏）を設定している。
sen.e: In the Urban Employment Area (10% urban area) from this viewpoint, an urban area is separately specified as Osaka urban area, Kyoto urban area and Kobe urban area (relative urban area).
Based on this viewpoint, the Urban Employment Area (10% urban area) has separately specified the Osaka urban area, Kyoto urban area and Kobe urban area (relative urban area).
sen.cmt: The designations in parenthesis are unclear. Referring official designations?
sen.e: Based on this viewpoint, the Urban Employment Area (10% commuter area [more than 10% of its population commuting to a central city]) has separately specified the Osaka urban area, Kyoto urban area and Kobe urban area (relative urban area).
sen.cmt: 「10％都市圏」という用語より「10％通勤圏」という用語の方が多く用いられているようです。定訳はわかりませんでしたが、補足を入れました。

sen.j: また、近代都市はその成長過程で工業を富の基盤とし、労働者を引き寄せて人口集中を実現する例が多い。
sen.e: In addition, there are many cases where a modern city would use industry as a base of the wealth in the course of its growth, attract workers and realize a concentration of population.
In addition, there are many cases where a modern city uses industry as a base of wealth in the course of its growth, attracting workers and thereby gaining in its concentration of population.
In addition, there are many cases where a modern city uses industry as a base of wealth in the course of its growth, attracting workers and thereby gaining in its concentration of population.

sen.j: 日本でも高度経済成長期まで、大都市の都市部では第二次産業人口が最も多かった。
sen.e: Also in Japan up until the high economic growth period, the population engaged in the second industries was the largest in urban areas in large cities.
Also up until Japan's period of high economic growth, the population engaged in the secondary industries was largest in the urban areas of large cities.
Also up until Japan's period of high economic growth, the population engaged in the secondary industries was largest in the urban areas of large cities.

sen.j: この観点から、世界的には工業地帯に形成された人口密集地帯を1つの「都市」とする例が見られる。
sen.e: From this viewpoint, it can be seen an example where a densely-populated zone formed in an industrial area would be specified as a 'city' on a worldwide basis.
From this perspective, a densely-populated zone formed in an industrial area being specified as a 'city'is something that is seen world-over
sen.cmt: Changed wording to make it more clear and natural.
sen.e: From this perspective, a densely-populated zone formed in an industrial area being specified as a 'city'is something that is seen world-over.
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドを付けました。

sen.j: この伝統的な見方に沿う場合、大阪市・神戸市を中心とした阪神工業地帯を1つの都市（都市圏）とし、近代重化学工業を基盤としない京都市を中心とした都市圏は別に扱う。
sen.e: In accordance with to this traditional viewpoint, the Hanshin Industrial Zone centered in Osaka City and Kobe City is specified as a city (urban area), and the urban area centered in Kyoto City which is not based on modern heavy chemical industries is treated separately.

In accordance with this traditional point of view, the Hanshin Industrial Zone centered in Osaka City and Kobe City is specified as a city (urban area), and the urban area centered in Kyoto City which is not based on modern heavy chemical industries is treated separately.
sen.cmt: Changed only the first phrase to make it more natural
sen.e: In accordance with this traditional point of view, the Hanshin Industrial Zone centered in Osaka City and Kobe City is specified as a city (urban area), and the urban area centered in Kyoto City which is not based on modern heavy chemical industries is treated separately.

sen.j: このように「阪神都市圏」と「京都都市圏」に分ける例は、国際連合のUrban Agglomerationやプライスウォーターハウスクーパース社の都市圏別GDPなどに見られる。
sen.e: The examples where it is divided into 'Hanshin urban area' and 'Kyoto urban area' in this manner can be seen in the Urban Agglomeration of the United Nations and the GDP by urban areas by PricewaterhouseCoopers Co., Ltd., etc.

Examples of it being divided in this manner into the 'Hanshin urban area' and 'Kyoto urban area' can be seen in the Urban Agglomeration of the United Nations and the GDP by urban areas by PricewaterhouseCoopers Co., Ltd., etc.
sen.cmt: Slight changes in wording and word order.
sen.e: Examples of it being divided in this manner into the 'Hanshin urban area' and 'Kyoto urban area' can be seen in the Urban Agglomeration of the United Nations and the GDP by urban areas by PricewaterhouseCoopers Co., Ltd., etc.

sen.j: 府県別の昼間人口と夜間人口（2005年国勢調査）
sen.e: Daytime population and night-time population by prefecture (from the national census in 2005)
Daytime population and night-time population by prefecture (from the 2005 national census)
Daytime population and night-time population by prefecture (from the 2005 national census)

sen.j: 古代には、奈良盆地に天皇（大君）がその在所を置くことが多く（→日本の首都）、その場合には港にあたる現在の堺市に向かう長尾街道・竹内街道などで両者は結ばれていた。
sen.e: In the ancient times, many emperors (tycoons) placed their hometowns (refer to the capitals in Japan) in the Nara Basin, and in this case, the current Sakai City serving as a port was connected with the hometowns by Nagao-kaido Road and Takeuchi-kaido Road, etc. bound for the city.

In the ancient times, many emperors (tycoons) placed their hometowns (refer to the capitals in Japan) in the Nara Basin, and in this case, the port in what is currently Sakai City was connected with those hometowns by Nagao-kaido Road, Takeuchi-kaido Road, etc. bound for the city.
sen.cmt: Slight changes in wording to make it more clear.
sen.e: In the ancient times, many emperors (tycoons) placed their hometowns (refer to the capitals in Japan) in the Nara Basin, and in this case, the port in what is currently Sakai City was connected with those hometowns by Nagao-kaido Road, Takeuchi-kaido Road, etc. bound for the city.

sen.j: 他方、外交が重視される時期や、奈良盆地の既存勢力と距離を置きたい場合には、日本海-若狭湾-琵琶湖-淀川-大阪湾-瀬戸内海の内陸水系物流ルート沿いの琵琶湖南岸以南に都が置かれた。
sen.e: On the other hand, in the period focused on diplomacy, or if an emperor would want to place a distance from the existing powers in the Nara Basin, a capital was placed in south of the southern coast of Lake Biwa along the inland water system logistics route from the Japan Sea, via Wakasa Bay, Lake Biwa, Yodo River, Osaka bay, and to the Seto Inland Sea.

On the other hand, in time periods focusing on diplomacy, or if an emperor wanted to establish themselves at a distance from the existing powers in the Nara Basin, their capitals were placed to the south of the southern coast of Lake Biwa along the inland water system logistics route from the Japan Sea, via Wakasa Bay, Lake Biwa, the Yodo River, Osaka Bay and to the Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: Changed wording to make it easier to read and more natural.
sen.e: On the other hand, in time periods focusing on diplomacy, or if an emperor wanted to establish themselves at a distance from the existing powers in the Nara Basin, their capitals were placed to the south of the southern coast of Lake Biwa along the inland water system logistics route from the Japan Sea, via Wakasa Bay, Lake Biwa, the Yodo River, Osaka Bay and to the Seto Inland Sea.

sen.j: 藤原京・平城京・平安京などの大規模な首都整備、豪族・貴族の在地から首都への集住強制、納税や官人の往来のための官道整備（→日本の古代道路）などにより、畿内は日本の富が集中する経済地域となっていった。
sen.e: Because of a large-scale preparation of the capitals, such as Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace; the ancient capital of Fujiwara), Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) and Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto), etc., the compulsion of concentrated dwelling of Gozoku (local ruling family) and nobles from their local lands into the capitals, and the preparation of Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) for traffic for tax payments and government officials (refer to the ancient roads of Japan), etc., Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) had become an economic area in which the wealth of Japan was concentrated.
sen.cmt: 「集住強制」は"compulsion of concentrated dwelling"と訳出しています。
sen.e: Because of a large-scale preparation of the capitals, such as Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace; the ancient capital of Fujiwara), Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) and Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto), etc., the compulsion of concentrated dwelling of Gozoku (local ruling family) and nobles from their local lands into the capitals, and the preparation of the Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) for traffic for tax payments and government officials (refer to the ancient roads of Japan), etc., the Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) had become an economic area in which the wealth of Japan was concentrated.
sen.cmt: No major changes but it would be better to break this up if possible. "Compulsion of concentrated dwelling" needs explanation or it will just baffle readers.
sen.e: Because of a large-scale preparation of the capitals, such as Fujiwara-kyo Palace, Heijo-kyo Palace and Heian-kyo Palace, the compulsion of concentrated dwelling of powerful regional clans and nobles from their local lands into the capitals, and the preparation of the official roads for tax payments and government officials, (refer to the ancient roads of Japan), the provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara (Kinai region) had become an economic area in which the wealth of Japan was concentrated.
sen.cmt: 重複する説明を略しました。

sen.j: その後、公家・武家・寺院に権力が分散し、税の畿内集中が弱まることもあったが、室町幕府や南朝 (日本)が置かれたり、貿易により兵庫や堺が伸張して富を集めた。
sen.e: Thereafter, the power was dispersed in kuge (court noble), buke (samurai family) and temples, and a concentration of taxes in Kinai region was sometimes weakened, however, it collected the wealth along with the placement of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and the South Court (Japan), and the extension of Hyogo and Sakai by trade.

Thereafter, the power was dispersed in kuge (court noble), buke (samurai family) and temples, and the concentration of taxes in Kinai region was sometimes weakened, however, wealth was taken in with the establishment of the the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and the South Court (Japan) as well as the extension of Hyogo and Sakai by trade.
sen.cmt: Still a little unclear if you don't already know the history of this region. Changed to make more natural and easy to read and understand.
sen.e: Thereafter, although the power was dispersed in court nobles, samurai families and temples, and the concentration of taxes in Kinai region was sometimes weakened, wealth was taken in with the establishment of the the Muromachi shogunate government and the South Court (Japan) as well as the expansion of Hyogo and Sakai by trade.

sen.j: 安土桃山時代に入ると織田信長や豊臣秀吉が当地に拠点を築いて経済改革を行い、また、大規模な手伝普請と城下町形成を行うことで人口の集住と経済発展が見られた。
sen.e: In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built their bases in the relevant area, and carried out economic reforms, and in addition, a concentration of population and an economic development were seen by conducting a large-scale tetsudai bushin (engineering work by federal lords under shogun's order) and by forming castle towns.

In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built their bases in the relevant area and carried out economic reforms, and in addition, a concentration of population and economic development were seen by conducting a large-scale tetsudai bushin (engineering work by federal lords under shogun's order) and by forming castle towns.

In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built their bases here and carried out economic reforms, and in addition, a concentration of population and economic development were seen by conducting a large-scale engineering works for the shogun (tetsudai bushin) and by forming castle towns.
sen.cmt: 手伝普請の説明を変えました。

sen.j: 江戸時代には、上述の内陸水系物流ルート上の京都・大坂（上方）に、海路では西廻り航路（北前船）や東廻り航路（菱垣廻船・樽廻船）が繋がり、陸路では五街道などが整備された。
sen.e: In the Edo period, the sea route from Edo to the western cities (kitamae-bune), and the sea route from Edo to the eastern cities (higaki-kaisen, taru-kaisen) were connected with Kyoto and Osaka (Kamigata) on the inland water system logistics route stated above as sea routes, and the Go-kaido Road, etc. were prepared as land routes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Edo period, the sea route from Edo to the western cities (kitamae-bune), and the sea route from Edo to the eastern cities (higaki-kaisen, taru-kaisen) were connected with Kyoto and Osaka (Kamigata) on the inland water system logistics route stated above as sea routes, and the Go-kaido Road, etc. were prepared as land routes.

In the Edo period, the westward sea route (from the northeast Japan to Osaka)(kitamae-bune vessel), and the eastward sea route (from the northeast Japan to Edo) (higaki-kaisen vessel, taru-kaisen vessel) were connected with Kyoto and Osaka (Kamigata area) on the inland water logistics route stated above, and the five main roads (Gokaido) were prepared as land routes.
sen.cmt: 西廻り航路、東廻り航路の説明が誤っていたので、変更いたしました。

sen.j: また、近江商人が日本各地に分散して上方を日本の物資の集散地および金融の中心地へと変えた（江戸幕府は、上方を直轄地とし、さらに御三家の内、東廻り航路の友ヶ島水道に紀州徳川家、東海道・中山道合流地に尾張徳川家を置いた）。
sen.e: And the Omi merchants dispersed in various areas in Japan, and changed Kamigata to a distributing center of the goods in Japan and a financial center (the Edo bakufu directly controlled Kamigata, and further, among Tokugawa gosanke [three privileged branches of Tokugawa family,] placed the Kishu Tokugawa family on Tomogashima Channel in the sea route from Edo to the eastern cities, and the Owari Tokugawa family on the junction of Tokai-do Road and Nakasen-do Road).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And the Omi merchants dispersed in various areas in Japan, changing Kamigata to a distributing center of goods in Japan and a financial center (the Edo bakufu directly controlled Kamigata, and moreover, among Tokugawa gosanke [three privileged branches of Tokugawa family,] placed the Kishu Tokugawa family on the Tomogashima Channel in the sea route from Edo to the eastern cities, and the Owari Tokugawa family on the junction of Tokai-do Road and Nakasen-do Road).

And the Omi merchants dispersed in various areas in Japan, changing Kamigata area to a collection and distribution center and financial center of Japan (the Edo shogunate directly controlled Kamigata area, and moreover, among three privileged branches of Tokugawa family, placed the Kishu Tokugawa family on the Tomogashima Channel in the eastward sea route, and the Owari Tokugawa family on the junction of Tokai-do Road and Nakasen-do Road).

sen.j: 大坂には各藩の蔵屋敷が集まり、世界初の商品先物取引所たる堂島米会所が置かれ、遠隔地取引での為替手形も用いられるようになり、大坂は「天下の台所」として日本経済の中心地となった。
sen.e: In Osaka, Kurayashiki-warehouses of each domain were concentrated, and the dojima rice exchange, the first commodity futures exchange in the world was placed, and the bills of exchange in long-distance transactions also come to be used, which caused Osaka to be the center of the Japanese economy as the 'kitchen of Japan.'

In Osaka, Kurayashiki-warehouses of each domain were concentrated, the dojima rice exchange, the first commodity futures exchange in the world, was established, and bills of exchange for long-distance transactions also came to be used, making Osaka, the 'kitchen of Japan,' the center of the Japanese economy.
sen.cmt: Changed wording and word order to make it read more naturally.
sen.e: In Osaka where warehouses of each domain were concentrated, the Dojima Rice Exchange, the first commodity futures exchange in the world, was established, and bills of exchange for long-distance transactions also came to be used, making Osaka, the 'kitchen of Japan,' the center of the Japanese economy.
sen.cmt: 音訳を略しました。the Dojima Rice Exchangeと大文字にしました。

sen.j: 京は富裕層向けを初めとした高付加価値商品生産地、すなわち工業都市として発展し、製品・職人が日本各地へと流れ、付随して京文化の影響を各地に与えた。
sen.e: Kyoto had been developed as a production area of high-value-added commodities, including those for wealthy people, that is to say, an industrial city, and the products and craftsmen were transferred to various areas in Japan, which incidentally had effects of the culture in Kyoto thereon.

Kyoto had been developed as a high-value-added commodities production area, that is to say, an industrial city, beginning with products geared toward the wealthy class, its products and craftsmen circulating around various areas in Japan, which brought the accompanying influence of Kyoto culture to those regions thereon.

Kyoto had been developed as a high-value-added commodity production area, or industrial city, such as those for the wealthy class, and its products and craftsmen circulated around various areas in Japan, which brought the accompanying influence of Kyoto culture to those regions thereon.

sen.j: 明治の開国を通じ神戸が国際貿易港として発展し、大阪・京都も都市の近代化が進んでいった。
sen.e: Kobe had been developed as an international trade port through the opening of Japan to the world in the Meiji era, and in Osaka and Kyoto, a modernization of the cities had been advanced.
Kobe had been developed as an international trade port through the opening of Japan to the world in the Meiji era, and in Osaka and Kyoto, modernization of the cities had advanced.
After the opening of Japan to the world in the Meiji era, Kobe had been developed as an international trade port and modernization of the cities in Osaka and Kyoto had also advanced.

sen.j: 「天下の台所」と呼ばれた経済都市の大阪は健在であったが、江戸期以来参勤交代で富裕層の集住に成功して大消費地となった江戸が、東京となって中央集権体制を確立し、税と外貿で富を更に集めるようになった。
sen.e: Osaka, an economic city which was called the 'kitchen of Japan,' was in good health, however, Edo, which had succeeded in a concentrated dwelling of wealthy people by Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) since the Edo period, and become a large consuming area, was changed to Tokyo and established the centralized administrative framework, and came to collect more wealth by taxes and foreign trade.

Osaka, an economic city which was called the 'kitchen of Japan,' was in good health, however, Edo, which had since the Edo period succeeded in a concentrated dwelling of wealthy people by Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo), had become a major consumer area, was changed to Tokyo and established a centralized administrative framework, and came to collect more wealth by taxes and foreign trade.

As Osaka, an economic city called the 'kitchen of Japan,' was in good health, Edo succeeded in attracting many wealthy people by Sankinkotai system (a daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo) and became a major consumer area in Edo period, and after changing its name to Tokyo, established a centralized administrative framework, and came to collect more wealth by taxes and foreign trade.
sen.cmt: 江戸期と明治の時制がわかりにくいように感じたので、左記のように変更いたしました。

sen.j: しかし明治27年に勃発した日清戦争を契機に大阪は「東洋のマンチェスター」と呼ばれる日本最大の商工業都市に発展し、神戸は東洋最大の港湾都市へ飛躍するなど、再び日本における文化・経済の中心地となった（阪神間モダニズムも参照）。
sen.e: However, taking advantage of the Sino-Japanese War which broke out in 1984, Osaka had been developed into the largest industrial and commercial city in Japan which was called a 'Manchester of the East,' and Kobe had rapidly been progressed to the largest port city in the East, etc., which caused the cities to be the center of culture and economy in Japan again (also refer to the Hanshin-kan Modernism).
sen.cmt: 「東洋のマンチェスター」は"Manchester of the East"と訳出しています。（登録）
sen.e: However, through the Sino-Japanese War which broke out in 1894, Osaka developed into the largest industrial and commercial city in Japan, called the 'Manchester of the East,' while Kobe had rapidly progressed to become the largest port city in the East, etc., causing the cities to once more be the center of culture and economy in Japan (also refer to the Hanshin-kan Modernism).
sen.cmt: Changed to make it more natural and remove some of the passive voice. Not sure about keeping that "etc."
sen.e: However, through the Sino-Japanese War which broke out in 1894, Osaka developed into the largest industrial and commercial city in Japan, called the 'Manchester of the East,' while Kobe had rapidly progressed to become the largest port city in the East, causing the cities to once more be the center of culture and economy in Japan (also refer to the Hanshin-kan Modernism).

sen.j: さらに大正12年の関東大震災後には関東からの移住者が多数あり、文化・経済の更なる興隆を見た。
sen.e: Further, after the Great Kanto Earthquake in 1923, there were many immigrants from Kanto region, which caused a further rise to be seen in the culture and economy.
Further, after the Great Kanto Earthquake in 1923, there were many immigrants from the Kanto region, which caused a further increase boom in the culture and economy.
Further, after the Great Kanto Earthquake in 1923, there were many immigrants from the Kanto region, which caused a further increase boom in the culture and economy.

sen.j: 昭和10年代、日中戦争から第二次世界大戦へ突入していく中で近衛文麿政権により戦時体制が作られ、様々な業種が国家の統制管理に置かれる状況となった。
sen.e: During the second half of the 1930s and the first half of the 1940s, in the course that the Sino-Japanese war was developed into World War II, the wartime regime was established by the Fumimaro KONOE's government, and various industrial sectors were brought to be placed under the control of the government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the second half of the 1930s and the first half of the 1940s, as the Sino-Japanese war was developing into World War II, the wartime regime was established by Fumimaro KONOE's government, and various industrial sectors were put under the control of the government.
sen.cmt: Changed wording to make it more natural.
sen.e: During the second half of the 1930s and the first half of the 1940s, as the Sino-Japanese war was developing into World War II, the wartime regime was established by Fumimaro KONOE's government, and various industrial sectors were put under the control of the government.

sen.j: このため、京阪神や他の地域の企業が統合されて東京に本社を置くことになったり、京阪神から東京へ企業や財閥・資本家の移動が相次いだ。
sen.e: For this reason, the companies in Keihanshin and other areas were integrated and forced to place the headquarters in Tokyo, and companies, Zaibatsu (a financial clique or group, or company syndicate) and capitalists moved from Keihanshin to Tokyo one after another.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For this reason, companies in Keihanshin and other areas were integrated and forced to place their headquarters in Tokyo, and companies, Zaibatsu (a financial clique or group, or company syndicate) and capitalists moved from Keihanshin to Tokyo one after another.

For this reason, companies in Keihanshin and other areas were integrated and forced to place their headquarters in Tokyo, and companies, zaibatsu conglomerates and capitalists moved from Keihanshin to Tokyo one after another.
sen.cmt: 財閥の説明を簡略化しました。

sen.j: 戦後、阪神工業地帯などでの工場・事業所の新設や拡張などで、製造業生産高が増大していくが、東京一極集中による東京への本社や事業所の移転はその後も継続している。
sen.e: After the war, a manufacturing output had been increased by newly constructing and expanding factories and business places in the Hanshin Industrial Zone, etc., however, the headquarters and business places have continuously been moved to Tokyo also thereafter because of an excess concentration in Tokyo.

After the war, manufacturing output was increased by newly constructing and expanding factories and business establishments in the Hanshin Industrial Zone, etc., however, because of Tokyo's excess concentration, headquarters and business establishments have continued to move to Tokyo thereafter.
sen.cmt: Perhaps "high population concentration" or something else would make this more clear?
sen.e: After the war, manufacturing output was increased by new construction or expansion projects of factories and business establishments in the Hanshin Industrial Zone; however, because of unipolar concentration of Tokyo, headquarters and business establishments have continued to move to Tokyo thereafter.
sen.cmt: 一極集中はunipolar concentrationとしました。

sen.j: 一方、研究設備や研究成果、教授陣が充実している大学や、関西文化学術研究都市や神戸医療産業都市構想を初めとした産学官連携研究施設が集積しており、経済面の環境が縮小している訳ではない。
sen.e: On the other hand, the universities which have excellent research equipment, research achievements and professors, and the research facilities based on industry-academia-government collaboration, including the Kansai Science City and the Kobe Medical Industry Development Project are concentrated in the area, and it is not the case that the economical environment would be decreased in size.

On the other hand, universities with excellent research equipment, research achievements and professors, and research facilities based on industry-academia-government collaboration, including the Kansai Science City and the Kobe Medical Industry Development Project, are concentrated in the area, and it is not the case that the economical environment would decrease their size.
sen.cmt: Changed wording to make it more natural and easy to understand.
sen.e: On the other hand, universities with excellent research equipment, research achievements and professors, and research facilities based on industry-academia-government collaboration, including the Kansai Science City and the Kobe Medical Industry Development Project, are concentrated in the area, and it is not the case that the economical environment would decrease their size.

sen.j: PwC社のリポートでは、阪神地区のGDPが世界の都市圏の7位、マスターカード社のリポートでは、世界のビジネス都市としての環境の評価で19位を格付けされるなど、世界的には未だ巨大な経済圏である。
sen.e: According to a report by PwC (PricewaterhouseCoopers Co., Ltd.,) GDP in Hanshin area is the 7th in the urban areas in the world, and in a report by MasterCard International Incorporated, the area, which was, as a world business city, ranked as the 19th in the environmental assessment, is still a huge economic area.
sen.cmt: 「PwC社」は"PwC (PricewaterhouseCoopers Co., Ltd.)"と訳出しています。
sen.e: According to a report by PwC (PricewaterhouseCoopers Co., Ltd.), the GDP in the Hanshin area is the 7th largest in world urban areas, and in a report by MasterCard International Incorporated, the area, which was ranked 19th as a world business city in the environmental assessment, is still a huge economic area.
sen.cmt: Changed wording to make it more natural and more concise.
sen.e: According to a report by PwC (PricewaterhouseCoopers Co., Ltd.), the GDP of the Hanshin area is the 7th largest among those of world urban areas, and according to business environment assessment by MasterCard International Incorporated, this area is ranked 19th, and still a huge economic area in the world.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更いたしました。

sen.j: 大きな都市圏を形成している京阪神ではあるが、かなり起伏の富んだ地形が広がっている。
sen.e: Keihanshin forms a large urban area, however, a considerably undulating landscape spreads therein.
Keihanshin forms a large urban area, however, a considerably undulating landscape spreads therein.
Keihanshin forms a large urban area; however, a considerably undulating landscape spreads therein.

sen.j: 主に大阪平野を中心に、播磨平野・京都盆地・奈良盆地・近江盆地に広がっている。
sen.e: It spreads in the Harima Plain, Kyoto Basin, Nara Basin and Omi Basin, mainly centered in the Osaka Plain.
It spreads over the Harima Plain, Kyoto Basin, Nara Basin and Omi Basin, mainly centered in the Osaka Plain.
It spreads over the Harima Plain, Kyoto Basin, Nara Basin and Omi Basin, mainly centered in the Osaka Plain.

sen.j: この点で、起伏の少ない関東平野を中心として放射状に広がっている東京圏と比べると、生駒山地や六甲山地などの山地を挟んで都市が広がっている京阪神と大きく異なっている。
sen.e: In this point, Keihanshin in which cities spread across mountains, such as Ikoma Mountains and Rokko Mountains, etc. is widely different from Tokyo area which spreads in a radial fashion with the center in the Kanto Plain.

In this point, Keihanshin, in which the cities spread across mountains, such as the Ikoma Mountains and Rokko Mountains, is very different from the Tokyo area, which spreads out in a radial fashion with the center in the Kanto Plain.

In this point, Keihanshin, in which the cities spread across mountains, such as Ikoma Mountains and Rokko Mountains, is very different from the Tokyo area, which spreads out in a radial fashion with the center in the Kanto Plain.
sen.cmt: 生駒山地のtheを取りました。

sen.j: 地形
sen.e: Geographical features
Geographical features
Geographical features

sen.j: 平野・盆地…大阪平野、播磨平野、京都盆地、奈良盆地、亀岡盆地、近江盆地、山科盆地、上野盆地
sen.e: Plains, basins --- Osaka Plain, Harima Plain, Kyoto Basin, Nara Basin, Kameoka Basin, Omi Basin, Yamashina Basin and Ueno Basin
Plains, basins --- Osaka Plain, Harima Plain, Kyoto Basin, Nara Basin, Kameoka Basin, Omi Basin, Yamashina Basin and Ueno Basin
Plains, basins: Osaka Plain, Harima Plain, Kyoto Basin, Nara Basin, Kameoka Basin, Omi Basin, Yamashina Basin and Ueno Basin

sen.j: 山地・山…生駒山地、六甲山地、紀伊山地、比叡山、生駒山、大江山、金剛山 (金剛山地)
sen.e: Mountainous regions, mountains --- Ikoma Mountains, Rokko Mountains, Kii Mountains, Mt. Hiei, Mt. Ikoma, Mt. Oe and Mt. Kongo (Kongo Mountains)
Mountainous regions, mountains --- Ikoma Mountains, Rokko Mountains, Kii Mountains, Mt. Hiei, Mt. Ikoma, Mt. Oe and Mt. Kongo (Kongo Mountains)
Mountainous regions, mountains: Ikoma Mountains, Rokko Mountains, Kii Mountains, Mt. Hiei, Mt. Ikoma, Mt. Oe and Mt. Kongo (Kongo Mountains)

sen.j: 川…淀川、大和川、加古川、揖保川、紀の川
sen.e: Rivers --- Yodo River, Yamato River, Kako River, Ibo River and Kino River
Rivers --- Yodo River, Yamato River, Kako River, Ibo River and Kino River
River: Yodo River, Yamato River, Kako River, Ibo River and Kino River

sen.j: 湖…琵琶湖
sen.e: Lakes --- Lake Biwa
Lakes --- Lake Biwa
Lakes: Lake Biwa

sen.j: 気候
sen.e: Climate
Climate
Climate

sen.j: 気象予報などの地方区分では、近畿中部に分類される。
sen.e: According to the regional classifications of weather forecast, etc., it is classified as the middle part of Kinki.
According to the regional classifications of weather forecasting and such, it is classified as the middle part of the Kinki region.
According to the regional classifications of weather forecasting and such, it is classified as the middle part of the Kinki region.

sen.j: 主に平野部では瀬戸内海式気候、京都府南部・滋賀県南部・奈良県北部・三重県伊賀地方・伊賀地方などの内陸部は内陸性気候に属する。
sen.e: Mainly, the plains belong to the Seto Inland Sea climate, and the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, southern part of Shiga Prefecture, northern part of Nara Prefecture and Iga region of Mie Prefecture belong to the inland climate.

The plains mainly belong to the Seto Inland Sea climate, while the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, the southern part of Shiga Prefecture, the northern part of Nara Prefecture and the Iga region of Mie Prefecture belong to the inland climate.
sen.cmt: Changed wording slightly for better readability.
sen.e: The plains mainly belong to the Seto Inland Sea climate, while the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, the southern part of Shiga Prefecture, the northern part of Nara Prefecture and the Iga region of Mie Prefecture belong to the inland climate.

sen.j: また阪神地域では六甲山から六甲山六甲颪、滋賀県湖西地域では比良山から比良颪が吹き荒れる。
sen.e: Further, in Hanshin area, a Rokko Oroshi (cold wind) blows down from Mt. Rokko, and in Kosei area of Shiga Prefecture, a Hira Oroshi blow hard down from Mt. Hira.
sen.cmt: 「六甲山六甲颪」は"Rokko Oroshi (cold wind)"と訳出しています。（登録）
sen.e: The plains mainly belong to the Seto Inland Sea climate, while the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture, the southern part of Shiga Prefecture, the northern part of Nara Prefecture and the Iga region of Mie Prefecture belong to the inland climate.
Further, in Hanshin area, the seasonal cold wind named 'Rokko Oroshi' blows down from Mt. Rokko, and in Kosei area of Shiga Prefecture, the Hira Oroshi wind from Mt. Hira.
sen.cmt: 六甲颪の説明を変更しました。

sen.j: また都市地域に広く覆われていることからヒートアイランド現象がみられ、冬の冷え込みの弱さや夏の猛暑がもたらされ、その現象によって気候修飾を受ける。
sen.e: In addition, since it is widely covered with urban areas, a heat-island phenomenon is seen, which brings about a weak coldness in winter and a fierce heat in summer, and the climate is modified by the phenomenon.

In addition, since it is widely covered with urban areas, a heat-island phenomenon is seen, which brings about a tendency toward coldness in winter and fierce heat in summer, as the climate is modified by this phenomenon.
sen.cmt: Changed translation. I don't think it should mean "a weak coldness."
sen.e: In addition, since it is widely covered with urban areas, a heat-island phenomenon is seen, which brings about a tendency toward coldness in winter and fierce heat in summer, as the climate is modified by this phenomenon.

sen.j: 京阪神では、アメリカ合衆国の例に倣ったインターアーバン（都市間電車）路線の建設が盛んとなった。
sen.e: In Keihanshin, the construction of the interurban routes (inter-city trains) in imitation of the examples in the United States of America became active.
In Keihanshin, construction of the interurban routes (inter-city trains) modeled after those of the United States of America has flourished.
sen.cmt: Changed wording to make it more natural
sen.e: In Keihanshin, construction of the interurban routes (inter-city trains) modeled after those of the United States of America has flourished.

sen.j: 阪神本線（1905年開業）を嚆矢とし、続く箕面有馬電気軌道（後の阪急宝塚本線、1910年開業）、阪急神戸本線（1920年開業）ほかの各線の開通は、神戸・北摂の未開拓な後背地であった近郊農村地帯への着目のきっかけとなった。
sen.e: Beginning with the Hanshin Line (started in 1905), the opening of subsequent Minoo Arima Electric Tramway (later Hankyu Takarazuka Main Line, started in 1910), Hanshin Kobe Main Line (started in 1920) and other lines became a trigger for focusing on the suburban farming areas which had been unexploited hinterlands in Kobe and Hokusetsu region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Beginning with the Hanshin Line (started in 1905), the opening of the subsequent Minoo Arima Electric Tramway (later Hankyu Takarazuka Main Line, started in 1910), the Hanshin Kobe Main Line (started in 1920) and other lines became a trigger for focusing on the suburban farming areas which had previously been unexploited hinterlands in Kobe and Hokusetsu region.

Beginning with the Hanshin Line (started in 1905), the opening of the subsequent Minoo Arima Electric Tramway (later Hankyu Takarazuka Main Line, started in 1910), the Hanshin Kobe Main Line (started in 1920) and other lines became a trigger for focusing on the suburban farming areas which had previously been unexploited hinterlands in Kobe and Hokusetsu region.

sen.j: そして、快適な住環境創造を目的とする郊外住宅地の開発が、鉄道沿線である風光明媚な六甲山南斜面、いわゆる阪神間において進められた（阪神間モダニズム）。
sen.e: And the development of the suburban residential area for the purpose of creating comfortable living environment was promoted in the scenic southern slope of Mt. Rokko along the railroads, that is to say, the Hanshin-kan (Hanshin-kan Modernism).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And the development of a suburban residential area for the purpose of creating a comfortable living environment was promoted along the scenic southern slope of Mt. Rokko through the railroads, that is to say, the Hanshin-kan (Hanshin-kan Modernism).

And the development of a suburban residential area for the purpose of creating comfortable living environment was promoted in the space between two railroads, the scenic southern slope of Mt. Rokko along these railways, (Hanshin-kan Modernism).
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: また第二次世界大戦前後から阪神地域以外でも、阪急電鉄阪急京都本線や京阪電気鉄道京阪本線を中心とした京阪地域や、近鉄奈良線を中心とした阪奈地域、南海本線や南海高野線を中心とした泉州、南河内地域でも積極的に行われていくようになった。
sen.e: Further, even in the areas outside Hanshin area, the development had come to be voluntarily promoted from before and after World War II in Keihan area centered in the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line of Hankyu Corporation and the Keihan Main Line of Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., in Hanna area centered in the Kintetsu Nara Line, and in Senshu, Minamikawachi areas centered in the Nankai Main Line and Nankai-Koya Line.

Furthermore, even in the areas outside the Hanshin area, development had come to be voluntarily promoted from before and after World War II in the Keihan area centered along the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line of Hankyu Corporation and the Keihan Main Line of Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., in the Hanna area centered along the Kintetsu Nara Line, and in Senshu, the Minamikawachi areas centered along the Nankai Main Line and Nankai-Koya Line.

Furthermore, housing land development had come to be promoted actively before and after World War II, in the other areas outside the Hanshin area such as the Keihan area along the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line (Hankyu Corporation) and the Keihan Main Line (Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.), the Hanna area along the Kintetsu Nara Line, and Senshu and Minamikawachi areas along the Nankai Main Line and Nankai-Koya Line.

sen.j: とりわけ京阪神では私鉄が多くの路線を敷設して、鉄道会社が中心となって、沿線開発が進んでいった。
sen.e: Particularly in Keihanshin, private railroad companies laid many lines, and the development of the areas along the railroads had been promoted mainly by the railroad companies.
In Keihanshin in particular, private railroad companies laid down many lines, and development of the areas along the railroads were promoted mainly by the railroad companies.
In Keihanshin in particular, private railroad companies laid down many lines, and development of the areas along the railroads were promoted mainly by the railroad companies.

sen.j: 昭和末期から平成期に入る頃になると、通勤圏が遠方ギリギリにまで拡大する傾向が目立っている。
sen.e: In the period from the end of the Syowa era and the beginning of the Heisei era, a tendency that a commutable area would be expanded to its widest limit became conspicuous.
In the period from the end of the Showa era to the beginning of the Heisei era, the trend of expanding commutable areas to their widest limit became prominent.
In the period from the end of the Showa era to the beginning of the Heisei era, the trend of expanding commutable areas to their widest limit became prominent.

sen.j: 例えば、兵庫県の篠山市や京都府の園部町（現・南丹市）、奈良県の大淀町、三重県の青山町（現・伊賀市）、滋賀県の近江八幡市や高島市、和歌山県の橋本市までも拡大した。
sen.e: The commutable area has been expanded, for example, as far as Sasayama City in Hyogo Prefecture, Sonobe Town in Kyoto Prefecture (currently Nantan City), Oyodo Town in Nara Prefecture, Aoyama Town in Mie Prefecture (currently Iga City), Omihachiman City and Takashima City in Shiga Prefecture and Hashimoto City in Wakayama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The commutable area was expanded, for example, as far as Sasayama City in Hyogo Prefecture, Sonobe Town in Kyoto Prefecture (currently Nantan City), Oyodo Town in Nara Prefecture, Aoyama Town in Mie Prefecture (currently Iga City), Omihachiman City and Takashima City in Shiga Prefecture and Hashimoto City in Wakayama Prefecture.

The commutable area was expanded, for example, as far as Sasayama City in Hyogo Prefecture, Sonobe Town in Kyoto Prefecture (currently Nantan City), Oyodo Town in Nara Prefecture, Aoyama Town in Mie Prefecture (currently Iga City), Omihachiman City and Takashima City in Shiga Prefecture and Hashimoto City in Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: また、兵庫府民・奈良府民・滋賀府民・三重府民・和歌山府民という俗語も登場した。
sen.e: Further, some pieces of slang, such as Hyogo-Fumin (commuters from Hyogo Prefecture to Osaka Prefecture or Kyoto Prefecture), Nara-Fumin, Shiga-Fumin, Mie-Fumin and Wakayama-Fumin also appeared.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, some new slang also appeared, such as Hyogo-Fumin (commuters from Hyogo Prefecture to Osaka Prefecture or Kyoto Prefecture), Nara-Fumin, Shiga-Fumin, Mie-Fumin and Wakayama-Fumin.
sen.cmt: "Pieces of slang" is strange. Changed wording.
sen.e: Furthermore, some new slangs also appeared, such as Hyogo-fumin (lit. a resident of Osaka Prefecture), Nara-Fumin, Shiga-Fumin, Mie-Fumin and Wakayama-Fumin.
sen.cmt: この「府」は大阪のことでしょうから、そのように訳しました。

sen.j: その後は、都心回帰の傾向から通勤圏の拡大は弱まっている。
sen.e: Afterward, the expansion of the commutable area has been weakened due to a tendency of return to the heart of the city.
Afterward, the expansion of the commutable area weakened due to the tendency of people to return to the city centers.
Afterward, the expansion of the commutable area weakened due to the tendency of people to return to the city centers.

sen.j: 京阪神には以下の研究都市が存在する。
sen.e: The following research cities exist in Keihanshin.
The following research cities are located in Keihanshin.
The following research cities are located in Keihanshin.

sen.j: 詳細については、リンク先を参照。
sen.e: Refer to the linked URLs for details.
Refer to the linked URLs for details.
Refer to the linked URLs for details.

sen.e: Kansai Science City (Osaka Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture and Nara Prefecture)
Kansai Science City (Osaka Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture and Nara Prefecture)
Kansai Science City (Osaka Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture and Nara Prefecture)

sen.e: Harima Science Garden City (Hyogo Prefecture)
Harima Science Garden City (Hyogo Prefecture)
Harima Science Garden City (Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 神戸医療産業都市構想（兵庫県）
sen.e: Kobe Medical Industry Development Project (Hyogo Prefecture)
Kobe Medical Industry Development Project (Hyogo Prefecture)
Kobe Medical Industry Development Project (Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 神戸研究学園都市（兵庫県）
sen.e: Kobe Kenkyu Gakuen Toshi (Hyogo Prefecture)
Kobe Kenkyu Gakuen Toshi (Hyogo Prefecture)
Kobe Kenkyu Gakuen Toshi (Kobe Science City) (Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 国際文化公園都市（大阪府）
sen.e: International Culture Park (Osaka Prefecture)
International Culture Park (Osaka Prefecture)
International Culture Park (Osaka Prefecture)

sen.j: 現在の京阪神は五畿七道では畿内に相当し、日本の中では他の地域に先駆けて古くから交通が発達していた。
sen.e: Current Keihanshin corresponds to Kinai region in the Gokishichido (five provinces and seven circuits), and the traffic had been developed since ancient times ahead of other areas.
The current Keihanshin corresponds to the Kinai region in the Gokishichido (five provinces and seven circuits), and its transit system has advanced ahead of other areas of Japan since ancient times.
sen.cmt: Changed wording. Not sure about "Gokishichido" since "circuits" is a bit hard to understand.
sen.e: The current Keihanshin corresponds to the Kinai region in the Gokishichido area of the ancient map, and ahead of other areas of Japan transportation system was developed since ancient times.
sen.cmt: 五畿七道の説明を変更しました。

sen.j: こうした交通網の発達は、明治以降鉄道建設や道路整備により、京阪神を一体の地域としての性格を強めることに大きな影響を与えた。
sen.e: The development of such traffic networks had a large effect on strengthening the character of Keihanshin as an integrated area by the construction of railroads and the preparation of roads in and after the Meiji era.

The development of such traffic networks had a major effect on strengthening the character of Keihanshin as an integrated area by the construction of railroads and the maintenance of its roads in and after the Meiji era.

The development of such traffic networks had a major effect on strengthening the character of Keihanshin as an integrated area by the construction of railroads and the maintenance of its roads in and after the Meiji era.

sen.j: ただし、起伏のある地形や京都・大阪・神戸それぞれが都市としての核であることから、首都圏のように東京を中心として環状に交通網が延びているわけではないが、それぞれの核都市を中心に同心円状に拡がっている。
sen.e: However, because of the undulated landscape, and because Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe are a core as a city respectively, it's not to say that the traffic networks extend in a circular fashion with the center in Tokyo like the national capital region, but the traffic networks expand in a concentric fashion with the center in each city.

However, because of the undulating landscape, and because Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe each have their own city center, the traffic networks do not extend out in a circular fashion like the national capital region does with the center in Tokyo, but instead, the traffic networks expand in a concentric fashion with the center in each city.
sen.cmt: Changed wording significantly and left out "it's not to say" as it is redundant.
sen.e: However, because of the undulating landscape, and because Kyoto, as well as Osaka and Kobe, is its own city center in itself, the traffic networks do not extend out in a circular fashion like the Tokyo metropolitan area with the center in Tokyo, but instead, the traffic networks expand in a concentric fashion with the center in each city.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更いたしました。

sen.j: 京阪神三都市間には複数の鉄道事業者が路線を敷設しており、サービスや沿線開発においてJRと私鉄、また私鉄同士による熾烈な競合区間となっている。
sen.e: Multiple railroad companies have laid lines among the three cities in Keihanshin, which has formed the railroad sections that would be competed fiercely between JR and private railroads, or among private railroads with respect to the services and development of the areas along the railroads.

Multiple railroad companies have laid lines in the three cities in Keihanshin, forming sections of railroad that would be competed over fiercely between JR and private railroad companies as well as among competing private companies, with respect to servicing and developing the areas along the railroads.
sen.cmt: Tried to change wording to make it more clear and so it didn't say "railroad" quite so many times. The last comma is not needed but the sentence is so long I wanted to break it up a bit.
sen.e: Multiple railroad companies have laid lines in the three cities in Keihanshin, forming sections of railroad that would be competed over fiercely between JR and private railroad companies as well as among competing private companies, with respect to servicing and developing the areas along the railroads.

Hanshin Port is the name of the Super Central Port which integrates the main four ports.
